title: Antiviral therapeutic approaches for human rhinovirus infections
text: The viral infections with antiviral treatment options include HIV, hepatitis B and C virus, herpesvirus, influenza virus, human cytomegalovirus, varicella-zoster virus, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) and human papillomavirus
authors: Casanova, Victor; Sousa, Filipa H; Stevens, Craig; Barlow, Peter G

title: Human monoclonal antibodies as candidate therapeutics against emerging viruses
text: SARS-CoV belongs to the Coronavirus family, Coronavirus genus
authors: Jin, Yujia; Lei, Cheng; Hu, Dan; Dimitrov, Dimiter S.; Ying, Tianlei

title: Immunogenicity and Protection Efficacy of Subunit-based Smallpox Vaccines Using Variola Major Antigens
text:
Immunogenicity and protection efficacy of polyvalent recombinant variola protein vaccines and polyvalent DNA vaccines expressing variola antigens
 Immunization with the polyvalent recombinant VARV protein vaccines was significantly more immunogenic than immunization with the polyvalent VARV DNA vaccines (p<0
) VACV challenge in Balb/C mice immunized with DNA vaccines expressing variola antigens
 The protein vaccine was even more immunogenic than the live vaccinia vaccine in generating specific antibodies against three tested pox antigens
authors: Sakhatskyy, Pavlo; Wang, Shixia; Zhang, Chuanyou; Chou, Te-Hui; Kishko, Michael; Lu, Shan

title: Preparation of recombinant vaccines
text: Mice vaccinated with an influenza virus vaccine with LTB showed higher systemic and mucosal antibody responses than mice receiving the vaccine alone [82]
